author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In German lands where conflict is ever forecast,
A story unfolds, nay recession does it hold fast.
From April to June, her fortunes in her mast,
With Winter's teeth loosened, her household vows to last.

To the East we sail, where Taiwan mends her heart,
From contraction's icy grip, an economic fresh start.
A bloom in her chest, a second quarter smart,
Rising by measure, a canvas of hopeful art.

A canvas drawn by AstraZeneca, a story's deft weave,
Her shares rise, the market sighs, in her promise, they believe.
Second quarter gifts bestowed by the merchant in her reprieve,
Lies a tale of growth untold, a longer term reprieve.

feedItems.title: Germany Avoids Recession, But GDP Undershoots Forecasts
feedItems.description: Germany’s GDP flatlined from April to June compared with economy avoiding a recession, as household consumption stabilized after contracting in the winter.

feedItems.title: Taiwan's Economy Recovered in Second Quarter
feedItems.description: Taiwan’s economy rose 1.45% in the second quarter, recovering from two consecutive quarters of economic contraction.

feedItems.title: AstraZeneca Looks Set to Sustain Longer-Term Growth After 2Q Beat
feedItems.description: AstraZeneca shares rose almost 4% after its second-quarter results showed revenue and EPS ahead of market views, with the underlying business delivering strong growth, Shore Capital said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Lo! Copper enkindles with Helios' fire,
As Dragon's heart stirs, avails desire,
Trade-winds doth gain over mighty dread,
A hoard for the week, ne'er a loss to be bled.

See, the sable nectar drifts higher in worth,
Where 'gainst hardship, the Eagle shows forth,
Thy bounty, dawns five-fold and true,
Effulgence of data, a prosperous brew

Then a silvered spar - the Dollar and Euro,
Stood steeped in the stars, destiny's hero,
Yet Fates, with their quill write futures unknown,
'Tis data-ruled, yet the Dollar's star shone.

feedItems.title: Copper Set for Weekly Rise on China Stimulus Hopes
feedItems.description: Copper prices were firmer and on course for a weekly gain as expectations of Chinese stimulus have overcome fears about the nation’s metals demand.

feedItems.title: Oil Price Edges Higher as US Economy Looks Resilient
feedItems.description: Oil futures remained on course for a fifth consecutive weekly increase, with strong U.S. economic data on Thursday the latest factor giving prices a boost.

feedItems.title: Data-Dependency Could Favor Dollar Over Euro
feedItems.description: With both the Fed and the ECB saying that future rate decisions will depend on upcoming economic data, the short-term outlook for the dollar looks more favorable than the euro, Commerzbank said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Hear ye, hear ye, of BTP-Bund spread, through God's good grace,
Its yield remaineth in an attractive space.
No fears of turmoil political, thou see,
For this is where investors have pledged their fidelity.

The house of Sanofi, its outlook doth upgrade,
For earnings have outshone what seers had estimated.
Though sales have stumbled short of their destined place,
Thank God, for his blessings never cease.

AstraZeneca, mid healthcare's brewing sea,
Doth witness its core EPS rise a quarter, joyously.
The forecast of revenue doth sturdy stand,
Praise be to God, the holder of every land.

feedItems.title: Ten-Year BTP-Bund Spread Seen at Attractive Level in 2H
feedItems.description: The 10-year Italian BTP-German Bund yield spread is expected to remain at attractive levels, Societe Generale said, as domestic investors are still buying and it doesn’t foresee political tensions to emerge.

feedItems.title: Sanofi Upgrades Outlook After Earnings Beat
feedItems.description: Sanofi raised its 2023 EPS guidance after it reported second-quarter adjusted earnings that beat analysts’ expectations and despite sales falling short of estimates.

feedItems.title: AstraZeneca Core EPS Rises 25%; Maintains Revenue Outlook
feedItems.description: AstraZeneca said its second-quarter core earnings per share rose to $2.15, and reiterated its 2023 forceast for revenue to increase by a low-to-mid single-digit percentage.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Kretinsky's firm grip does Casino find,
A debt stalled, seeking peace for troubled mind,
Yet the goat bleats not in cheer, for the grind,
Dilutes the value shareholders might unwind.

Bank of Japan, like a hare, now hints at leaps,
The bond yields rise as the gentle rabbit peeps,
No rigid limit within the terrier's keeps,
Just a reference point where interest sleeps.

NatWest shines in second quarter's dance,
With profits large, yet guidance takes a chance,
The snail's modest gain, a mere askance,
As future margins present a daunting lance.

feedItems.title: Casino Strikes Debt Deal With Kretinsky-Led Consortium
feedItems.description: Casino has reached an agreement in principle with a consortium led by Daniel Kretinsky to shore up its capital base and restructure its debt, but would see shareholder value “massively diluted.”

feedItems.title: Bank of Japan Hints It Will Accept Higher Rates, Lifting Bond Yields
feedItems.description: The central bank calls cap on government bond yields a reference point, not a rigid limit.

feedItems.title: NatWest Second Quarter Tops Hopes But Trims Guidance
feedItems.description: NatWest posted an operating pretax profit of £1.8 billion for the second quarter and announced a £500 million share buyback, but lowered its net interest margin guidance for 2023.
